Departments took varying approaches to designing their minors

For example, anthropology is offering two versions of the same minor.

The entry level version requires a lower-level introductory course or lets the student pick two higher-level courses as their introduction to the department.

Students also have more freedom to pick electives.

The entry-level version requires a lower-level introductory course or lets the student pick two higher-level courses as their introduction to the department.

Source: Columbia College Bulletin

Graphic by Ayaan Ali
